Activity: Arrive at work, log into the EHR system, and check emails for updates and new communications. Pay special attention to any alerts related to EHR downtime or scheduled maintenance. Contact @Helpdesk-1 for clarification if anything is unclear.
Review the standardized protocols and tools for influenza symptom assessment within the EHR. Focus on any updates related to lab result interpretation or differential diagnosis criteria.
Begin patient assessments. Accurately assess the first patient for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR.
Address the second patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Assess the third patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Lunch Break, Browse the lastest fashion.
Assess the fourth patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Address the fifth patient for influenza symptoms, using the standardized protocols and EHR-integrated tools. Meticulously document all observations and patient responses directly into the EHR.
Enter patient data into the EHR for patients seen today, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Cross-reference lab results with documented symptoms to identify potential discrepancies.
Review patient data entered by colleagues to ensure consistency and accuracy. Provide constructive feedback to @rn-1, @rn-2, and @rn-3 on areas for improvement in EHR documentation.
Prepare a summary of the day's activities, highlighting any challenges encountered with the EHR system or assessment protocols. Share this summary with @itpm-1 and @ehrv-1.
Log out of the EHR system and prepare for departure.
